intro: Aulomyrcia obtusa var. pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered aulomyrcia, is a rare shrub native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and guava. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
